core.words

Class BigWordCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.words.BigWordCollection

  • public class BigWordCollection
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages the collection of Big Words These Words are supplied through an input file. TODO / FUTURE: input file can be substituted with a SQL string
    Author:
    srj

    • Method Detail

      • getBigWordsTopicsTable

        public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<BigWord>> getBigWordsTopicsTable()

      • processBigWordsInputFile

        public void processBigWordsInputFile(java.lang.String filename)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Reads lines from a text file one by one and sends them to the addBigWord method. Catches a BigWordAdditionException if one is thrown, and exits the program as per instructions. It is possible however, to not exit and skip to the next line. This is a one line code change that involves removing the exit statement. reads UTF-8
        Parameters:
        filename - is a string that represents the path of the file to read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown if the file fails to load

      • addBigWord

        public void addBigWord(BigWord a_big_word)
        Adds a BigWord to the collection
        Parameters:
        a_big_word - is added to the collection

      • getBigWord

        public BigWord getBigWord(int index)
        NEW For getting a Big Word based on index
        Parameters:
        a_big_word - is added to the collection

      • addBigWord

        private void addBigWord(java.lang.String a_line)
                 throws BigWordAdditionException
        Adds a BigWord to the collection
        Parameters:
        a_line - is a single line of text with 16 values separated by 15 commas with values thirteen and fourteen being space delimited lists
        Throws:
        BigWordAdditionException - is thrown if the file is empty, a line has other than 15 commas, or the file contains duplicate items
